title: Trump 'will join Putin in Moscow at massive WW2 military parade' as Vlad plans to 'celebrate victory' over Ukraine
body:
MARCHING DON Trump 'will join Putin in Moscow at massive WW2 military parade' as Vlad plans to 'celebrate victory' over Ukraine

PRESIDENT Donald Trump is to join pal Vladimir Putin in Moscow for World War II commemorations.

It comes after the Republican slammed Ukrainian President Zelensky's approval ratings, called for fresh Ukraine elections and appeared to suggest that Ukraine started the war with Russia following the historic peace talks in Saudi Arabia.

3 Donald Trump (L) and Russian President Vladimir Putin arrive for a meeting in Helsinki in 2018 Credit: AFP

3 President Donald Trump speaks at Mar-a-Lago in Palm Beach on Tuesday

3 Putin speaks during while visiting the Radar MMC military plant today

The Republican will fly to Russia for Victory Day celebrations on May 9, according to French news magazine Le Point, citing Russian sources.

May 9 parades are held throughout Russia as a celebration of its defeat of Nazi Germany in 1945 that Putin has turned into a pillar of his nearly quarter-century in power and a justification of his invasion of Ukraine.

Victory Day is a means to showcase to the world the might of the Russian military machine, recall wartime sacrifice and garner national pride - all led by a showcase event in Moscow's Red Square.

Putin praised his Republican pal for "changing his position" when he "began to receive objective information" on Wednesday - a mere few hours after Zelensky slammed Trump for living in a "Russian disinformation bubble".

The tyrant said he welcomed Tuesday's talks between Russian and US officials in Saudi Arabia, dubbing them the "first step" to restore relations with Washington.

Speaking from a drone factory in Saint Petersburg, smug Vlad said: "I was briefed [on the talks]. I rate them highly, there is a result.

"In my opinion, we made the first step to restore work in various areas of mutual interests."

He added that ensuring there's a resolution to the conflict is a top priority for Russia, but explained that his country has to build trust with the US to achieve this.

In Kyiv, Deputy Minister of Defence Serhii Boiev hit back at Donald Trump's claim that European troops in Kyiv will spark World War Three.

He warned that without the presence of British or European allies, Putin will pretend to agree to a ceasefire while secretly "firing on all cylinders in recruiting and training".

The silver-haired top minister added that without a fresh pledge of military support from Trump, in three months time the army will experience a critical dip in weapons supplies.

In a secret briefing room, Mr Boiev told The Sun that Sir Keir Starmer was completely right to pledge "British boots on the ground" in Ukraine.

The Prime Minister made a rallying cry to Europe urging leaders to "step up" and deploy peacekeeping troops to Ukraine.

The PM vowed the UK will "do our bit" to try and enforce a peace deal.

Mr Boiev said: "If Ukraine doesn't go to Nato then Nato needs to go to Ukraine.

"We want European forces to be here to ensure a sustainable peace.

"The security guarantees that come out of this war are essential including the contingency of allies on the ground."

Labour MPs David Taylor and Phill Brickell, who met with Mr Boiev in Kyiv, said: "If the US falter, the UK must be willing to step up. The front line here in Ukraine is the front line for Brits. The evil tyrant Putin will not stop.

"Keir Starmer must set a rapid path to at least 2.5% on defence. We must look to support a new, protected supply chain of easy to make and easy to use warfare drones.

"And, we must designate all members of the United Russia Party as terrorists, using any sanctioned money for the war effort."

The dictator also shared that Trump was starting to receive "objective information", without elaborating.

He added: "We will be ready to return to the negotiating table".

Zelensky accused Moscow of misleading Trump in a press conference earlier - which the US President has since responded to in a tirade on his social media platform, Truth Social.

The Ukrainian president said this afternoon: "Unfortunately, President Trump, who we have great respect for as leader of the American people ... lives in this disinformation space."

Speaking right after the US and Russian foreign ministers held talks in Saudi Arabia, Zelensky continued: "We want security guarantees this year because we want to end the war this year."

claims.utterance_text: President Donald Trump will fly to Russia for Victory Day celebrations on May 9.
claims.source_context: The Republican will fly to Russia for Victory Day celebrations on May 9, according to French news magazine Le Point, citing Russian sources.

wikidata_info.description: 2nd and 4th President of Russia (2000–2008, 2012–present), 7th and 11th Prime Minister of Russia (1999–2000, 2008–2012), Director of the Federal Security Service (1998–1999) and Deputy Mayor of Saint Petersburg (1994–1996)

taxonomy_info.explanation: The article explicitly refers to Vladimir Putin as the Russian President, confirming both name and description.

reasoning.presence_detection: The article explicitly names "Russian President Vladimir Putin" and later refers to him simply as "Putin" in multiple contexts, confirming his presence in the text.
reasoning.statement_detection: Several direct quotations are attributed to Putin: "Putin praised his Republican pal for 'changing his position'…", "The tyrant said he welcomed Tuesday's talks…", and other statements spoken from a drone factory in Saint Petersburg. These are clear instances of the entity making statements.
reasoning.candidate_evaluation: Candidate Q7747 is the primary Wikidata entry for Vladimir Putin, the current President of Russia, matching the name, title, and political role described. The other candidates (Q19300851 and Q130234762) are unrelated relatives and do not fit the context or description.
reasoning.authority_verification: Q7747 holds the position of President of Russia and Supreme Commander‑in‑Chief, giving him full authority to make the statements quoted in the article.
reasoning.plausibility_assessment: The statements attributed to Putin are consistent with his public role and the political context of the article (Victory Day celebrations, diplomatic talks, etc.), making the attribution highly plausible.
reasoning.final_justification: All evidence—presence, direct quotations, and alignment with the primary Wikidata entry—supports identifying the referenced individual as Q7747. No other candidate matches the description or context.

speaker_type.explanation: The article explicitly refers to Vladimir Putin as the Russian President, confirming both name and description.

classification_outcome.explanation: The article explicitly refers to Vladimir Putin as the Russian President, confirming both name and description.

taxonomy_info.explanation: The article explicitly quotes "Labour MP David Taylor" and confirms his role as a Labour MP, matching both the name and description.

reasoning.presence_detection: The article explicitly names "Labour MPs David Taylor and Phill Brickell" and quotes David Taylor, confirming his presence as a Labour MP.
reasoning.statement_detection: David Taylor is quoted directly: "If the US falter, the UK must be willing to step up. The front line here in Ukraine is the front line for Brits. The evil tyrant Putin will not stop." Thus he is making statements.
reasoning.candidate_evaluation: Among the provided candidates, Q126937373 is a British politician affiliated with the Labour Party and currently a member of the 59th UK Parliament (start date 2024‑07‑04). This matches the description of a Labour MP. The other candidates are unrelated professions or lack the Labour Party affiliation and parliamentary role.
reasoning.authority_verification: Q126937373 holds a parliamentary seat and is a Labour MP, giving him the appropriate authority to speak on UK defence and foreign policy matters.
reasoning.plausibility_assessment: It is highly plausible for a Labour MP to comment on UK involvement in Ukraine and to be quoted in a news report about a meeting with a Ukrainian defence minister.
reasoning.final_justification: The entity David Taylor is present in the article, is making statements, and the best matching Wikidata candidate is Q126937373, which aligns with the target description of a Labour MP.

taxonomy_info.explanation: The article quotes Volodymyr Zelensky and explicitly identifies him as the Ukrainian president, matching both the name and description.

reasoning.identity_verification_and_presence: The article explicitly mentions "Ukrainian President Zelensky" and later refers to him simply as "Zelensky". The context—talking about Ukraine, the war, and diplomatic talks—matches the Wikidata description of Volodymyr Zelensky as the President of Ukraine. No other individual named Zelensky is discussed, and the role and national affiliation align perfectly with the Wikidata entity.
reasoning.statement_assessment: Zelensky is quoted directly in the article: "Unfortunately, President Trump ... lives in this disinformation space." and "We want security guarantees this year because we want to end the war this year." These are clear statements attributed to him.
reasoning.plausibility_assessment: It is entirely plausible for the Ukrainian President to make such statements about the war, security guarantees, and criticism of the U.S. President. The content aligns with his official role and public statements.
reasoning.contradiction_analysis: No contradictions were found between the article’s depiction of Zelensky and the Wikidata profile. The article’s references and quotes are consistent with his position as President of Ukraine.

speaker_type.explanation: The article quotes Volodymyr Zelensky and explicitly identifies him as the Ukrainian president, matching both the name and description.

classification_outcome.explanation: The article quotes Volodymyr Zelensky and explicitly identifies him as the Ukrainian president, matching both the name and description.
